poem:
Title: "Upon Reading of Britain's Woe"

Quivering, Britannia's Wealth,
Hummingbirds of gold in stealth,
Vanishing in morning's frost,
Promised gains, now lost.
Sunak's blueprint tinted grey,
Revised figures hold sway.
Peal of bells, deep and hollow,
Foretell a tomorrow
Steeped in tears of economic bane,
Britannia, in recession's chain.
Pound's grief mired in ink,
A lament for an economy on the brink.
